intro: Papaver rhodopeum, commonly known as the Bulgarian poppy, is a herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is characterized by its striking red to orange flowers with a blackened center, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are surrounded by a series of small, petal-like bracts that give it a distinctive appearance. Papaver rhodopeum is often found in meadows and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
